campaign.story:
Poetry Slam is a 3-8 Player party game that plays in 25-45 minutes.  The simple game play combined with clever scoring make this a brilliant casual game for gamers and non-gamers alike.
Never-before seen Deluxe Version for just $5!
This project is a special 10-day project for "pledge what you are able".  We are offering a fixed number of rewards to get the game out there with just 1000 of the Deluxe Version with a minimum pledge of $5.  We encourage you to pledge what you are able, but if $5 is all you can pledge, that is ok for us.  This is a crazy experiment to see if "seeding the market" will pay off for future print runs!  Note shipping costs and add-ons will be collected post-campaign during the Crowdox Survey process.
 CRAZY Pricing! To be honest, we LOVE this game, but it failed on Kickstarter last time at $40/copy (HERE).  We had a brilliant looking project, good reviews and everything looked great, but wow did it fail!  Rather than just let this project die we have teamed up with the factory to reboot this game.  We are going to produce  1000 copies of the Deluxe game.  We are doing the Deluxe game with ALL stretch goals unlocked and asking you backers to pay what you can.  We know the world is a crazy place right now and lots of us are hurting.  We are strictly limiting this campaign to just a few copies and will NEVER produce the Deluxe edition again!  
 KS Limited Exclusive Content! Deluxe copies will NOT enter distribution. Don't miss out on these awesome extras. 
 Stretch Rewards! All stretch rewards are UNLOCKED and every copy of the game will come with all the stretch rewards mentioned!
https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/247576/poetry-slam
Step One: Reveal a Letter Card and a Word Prompt, then all players simultaneously write a word behind their screen that fits the rule (sorta like Scattergories but with only one word):
 Step 2: When you have completed your word grab a Speed Tile, first come first served!
 Step 3: Using the word you created from Step 1, form a simple poem to clue in your fellow players as to your word.
Hint: The poem should be sort of like clues from Dixit, not so easy that someone can guess it before you even finish with your poem, in that case you only get two points. It also shouldn't be so hard that no one can guess it, then you get no points. You want it to be difficult but not too difficult, so at least one person guesses correctly after you finish the poem for 3 points!
Two final details: Snap Tokens. You must give three +1 point Snap Tokens to other players during the game, but no more than one per round. You also accumulate Slam Tokens when you break rules or use forbidden letters.

Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge: 
This image is updated with unlocked stretch goals.
28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players! 
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Stories expansion is available in the 'Gameplay All-In' reward tier or as an add-on in CrowdOx after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
Steven Rhodes is a graphic artist and illustrator best known for his offbeat reimagining of children’s activity books from the 70s and 80s. The Let’s Dig for Treasure, Let’s Summon Demons, and Don’t Talk to Strangers games will immerse you into these hilariously dark retro worlds. Featuring clever and beautiful fan-favorite artwork, each game is a wild romp through the parallel Rhodes universe. The games are quick to learn and are created for 2-6 players, ages 14 and up.
Dynomite Games is an old-school sub-brand of Cryptozoic Entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of licensed and original IPs, Cryptozoic’s catalog covers a broad spectrum of tabletop games and collectibles including Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards and the DC Deckbuilding games.

We've made simple, streamlined game engines (with very little set-up time) so that anyone can dive right in--but we've seasoned the games with enough hidden depth and unique design space to satisfy all of you hardcore gamers too!
Check out a brief overview of each of these games:
It's the funky-freshest Push-Your-Luck experience out there, for the whole family! Just shuffle up the deck and divide it into 3 "Dig Stacks" and you're ready to start digging for treasure!
1. On your turn, choose and "dig up" a card from any of the Dig Stacks...look for cards worth a lot of points, or cards that trigger a powerful effect, such as stealing a card from another player!  
2. You can stop digging at any time, or keep digging up cards for as long as you want...the more cards you dig up before you "stop," the more you stand to gain--but be careful--if you dig up a 2nd Worms Card, or even a SINGLE skeleton card, your turn will end immediately and you'll lose *EVERYTHING* you dug up so far (this turn)! 
3. Once an entire Dig Stack is empty, the game is over and players add up the total point values on their cards!  Be sure to look and see if you scored any "bonus point" effects (you did make sure to dig up some Milk to go with your Cookies, right?). 
4. You've got all kinds of zany stuff to find while digging: Loyal Dogs (protect you from a Skeleton!), Sewer Lines (worth negative points--give it to your least favorite opponent!), heck, you might even transcend death with The Crown of the Lich Lord, or turn those pesky worms into big points with Skwirmz the Worm God! 





What are little Johnny, Suzy, and Fido supposed to do when the suburban droll has them down? I know, Let's Summon Demons!  Whether you're building sadistic synergies with the "rotten" kids or sharing the love with the "sweet" kids, only the savviest (and luckiest!) player--the best Demon Summoner--will walk away a winner!
1. Shuffle up the Demon Deck and the Block Deck, and deal everyone a Starting Candle and a hand of 3 Demons. Your goal is to summon all 3 of those little devils before your opponents beat you to it... 
2. At all times, a rotating assortment of five cards will be available for purchase (the low, low price of 3 soul tokens) to all players--this is called THE BLOCK and it has Boys, Girls, and Animals of every style and strategy! Look for cards that combo together! 
3. On each players' turn, they'll roll the dice--if any player's cards they've acquired "match" the total rolled then that card activates--often resulting in the acquisition of more soul tokens! More soul tokens means more cards from THE BLOCK, means even more soul tokens--but to what end?
4. Well, you can sacr--er--discard 3 of your cards to SUMMON A DEMON! The most powerful cards of all! Once any player has summoned all 3 of their Demons --and has a balance of 10 souls on top of that--they are declared the ultimate Demon Summoner and the game is over! With all of the variety offered between the 20 unique demons and the diverse BLOCK DECK, there is plenty of content to explore and master!





School's out but otherworldly STRANGERS are here!  Mom & Dad haven't caught on yet so you're on your own, kiddo. Play your cards as efficiently as you can, helping to navigate your Kids one at a time from SCHOOL to a SCORING space--in order to score as many points as you can before the neighborhood is completely overrun with STRANGERS!
1. At the start of the game, each player will draw a hand of 3 cards and place one of their kids in the SCHOOL space. Your goal is to get that kid into a valuable scoring space, at which point you'll place a new kid in the SCHOOL space and repeat the process. Some spaces are worth more points at the end of the game, and some confer a unique bonus (for example, your hand size increases by 1 for each Kid you have in the Library). 
2. Remember, you want to score a good space, but you'll have to Walk, Run, Skateboard, School Bus, and even City Bus to get there! Each turn you'll play one card and draw a new card to replace it!  
3. But watch out!  When any player draws a STRANGER card, they can abduct any kid on a "STRANGER SPACE!" Furthermore, now that a STRANGER is lurking in that space, it is impassable for all future movement...so you may just have to re-route your plans on the fly! SAUCER cards can abduct *any* kid--even one that has already scored--but your opponent will have to get lucky when they flip the SAUCER COIN or you'll escape abduction!


Like what you see? Giggling with glee? Store each game together when you back all three! We personally guarantee that this sleek and convenient slipcase looks a lot better on your bookshelf than a haphazard stack of boxes!





We expect the game to start shipping in June 2021. It is English-only and we're shipping worldwide in partnership with Quartermaster Logistics. This game is "friendly" in terms of shipping (i.e., we cover customs/import taxes) to the US, Canada, EU, Australia, and New Zealand. Shipping rates are based on actual costs to ship your rewards (depending on your country) and will be charged as part of your pledge.
Please note: Due to COVID-19, most shippers have added surcharges to their rates. The amount we charge for shipping reflects the latest rates. In some regions, the cost of shipping may exceed the cost of the tier you’re pledging for; unfortunately, this cannot be avoided. In most cases, pledging for two or three games (“Double Trouble” and "Slipcase Exclusive" Tiers) costs almost the same in terms of shipping as pledging for one game.



This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

This is not our first rodeo! Cryptozoic has run several Kickstarters in the past, and we have learned a lot. We know fans invest not only their funds but their time in supporting Kickstarter campaigns. We take your commitment very seriously, and in return we are determined to provide you the very best game possible. The game is completely done and files are ready to print. However, even in normal times, delays can happen due to unexpected issues, such as shipping container delays, factory issues, bad weather, and more. These are clearly NOT normal times due to the COVID-19 pandemic, making any projected timelines uncertain. You have our word that we will do our best to mitigate delays and communicate about them to all the backers.

campaign.story:
The deck of stories Kickstarter is a collaboration between Critical Dice and 1985 Games.
 The Deck of Stories is a fresh new storytelling system that helps you create a legendary adventure in 15 minutes.
Every storyteller hits writer's block eventually. Whether you’re the lead creator or long-time DM, it’s going to happen. That’s where the Deck of Stories comes in.
It’s a flexible story-telling system of story hooks that will get your creative juices flowing. Each hook features next steps that help take you deeper into the moment and the unique ORC storytelling system that suggests where it would fit best in a storyline.
This Kickstarter includes the release of the Deck of Stories Volumes 1 and 2, as well as five-themed boosters and the Deck of Stories: Genesis Box.
In addition to the Deck of Stories Volume 1, the Deck of Stories: Genesis Box contains a set of NPC and Sensory Cards to help fill out your story even more. The NPC Cards are pre-generated, beautifully illustrated characters that you can insert seamlessly into your game. Each NPC Card has an NPC along with five traits that help you role-play that character. Add one when your players catch you off guard and you need an NPC on the spot, or use them to help fill in the role of a new character in your game.
The Sensory Cards engage the five senses with unique details that you can add to your adventure. Any time your story feels flat, choose a Sensory Card from the deck and use it to fill out your description of a room, or add interest to a situation.
Whether you're planning a story arc in your latest campaign or need an exciting one-shot for your next session, the Deck of Stories is a must-have tool for your story-creation arsenal.

        Are you ready to create a legendary adventure?
A crooked skeleton stands before you
Deck of Stories is Compatible with Roll20®
We’re happy to announce that digital versions of the cards will be available on Roll20. We’ve added new reward tiers to represent this new format with similar bundles to the physical versions. All backers who pledge for one of our digital tiers will receive a code that can be used to redeem your product on Roll20’s website. 

Roll20® is not responsible for the creation or timely delivery of this content.
Launch your adventure by shuffling the Story Cards and drawing three. After reading the prompts, arrange them in the order that makes the most sense to you, taking cues from the ORC story-telling system. Now you have a beginning, middle, and end for your story that’s loose enough to adapt but structured enough to move the story forward. Not what you wanted? Shuffle and re-draw.
A solid O, R, or C at the top of each card helps you decide where to place it in your story structure. Keep in mind that the story structure you create is not rigid. Story Cards can often be used in more than one section of a story.

His eyes are full of sorrow as he stares the party down
NPC Cards feature pre-generated, beautifully illustrated characters that you can insert seamlessly into your game.

Each NPC contains a collection of traits that help you role-play that character in your game. The traits develop the character yet keep their background vague enough for you to cast them in any role.

Lead artist on the NPC Cards @Inkognit_art 
These cards add depth and interest by engaging the five senses to add intrigue or create potential confusion. Sensory cards can be added anywhere in your story to create a memorable encounter.


Volume 1 of The Deck of Stories contains the first 50 story hooks in this series. The collection covers a wide range of fantasy themes and ideas.

Volume 2 of the Deck of Stories is the second set of 50 story hooks in the series. Like volume 1, volume 2 covers a wide range of fantasy story ideas and is a stand-alone product.

The Genesis Box is a collection of some of our best products, as well as our exclusive set of Sensory and NPC Cards that can only be found inside. The Genesis Box includes the entire Volume 1 Deck of Stories, all of the NPC cards from both NPC boosters, as well as 4 exclusive NPCs, and 18 exclusive sensory cards.

The Gears Booster has 18 steampunk-themed story hooks only found in this expansion. This pack is perfect for anyone playing in the world of “Eberron” or others like it.

The Gothic Booster has 18 gothic horror-themed story hooks only found in this expansion. This pack Is perfect for anyone playing “The Curse of Strahd” or other adventures like it.
The Hell Booster has 18 infernal-themed story hooks only found in this expansion. This pack is perfect for anyone playing “Decent into Avernus” or similar adventures.

The HighWater Booster has 18 sea faring-themed story hooks only found in this expansion. This pack Is perfect for anyone playing the “Ghosts of Saltmarsh” adventure or adventures like it.

The Jungle Booster has 18 jungle-themed story hooks only found in this expansion. This pack is perfect for anyone playing the “Tomb of Annihilation” or if you'd like to run adventures like it.
These same cards can also be found in The Deck of Stories: Genesis Box

The NPC Booster 1 has the first 18 NPC Cards in it. These NPCs cover a wide variety of races and characteristics, making them unique and interesting to role-play.
These same cards can also be found in The Deck of Stories: Genesis Box
The NPC Booster 2 contains an additional 18 NPC Cards. These NPCs cover a wide variety of races and characteristics, making them unique and interesting to role-play.
Strange things are afoot
Estimated Shipping Costs 
These prices are estimates and are subject to change after the Kickstarter ends.

If you’re interested in purchasing the Deck of Stories or other products for a retail location or website contact us at deckofstories@1985games.com

updates.update_content: Hello friends, we were hoping that this would be our final update where we could announce that everyone had received their package, but it looks like the powers that be wish to continue our trials. After continued delays and lack of information from our EU fulfillment hub we finally received an email over the weekend. Apparently the EU fulfillment warehouse has recently had a confirmed COVID case and are currently operating at reduced capacity. We are also still hearing reports that COVID cases are slowing down customs clearance for freight in and out of Germany.

My friend Dungeon Master Dave has just launched an amazing Kickstarter for his project, Pexia's Guide to Omeria!

I love homebrew worlds and campaigns, especially when they are written by a machine like Dave. Also, you have to see some of the art on these books!

We are very sorry for the delays in this update. It seemed that every time we went to create this we received another email that gave us pause. We are pleased that we can finally make this announcement, European shipping will resume this week! This includes shipping to South America, Central America, Mexico and Africa. We thank you so much for your patience as we have dealt with all of the issues that have come up during this campaign and thank you for all the kind words of support and encouragement that we have received.

Nearly There!

We are cruising through this fulfillment process and we are ecstatic to announce that we have completed all of our Australian and North American orders! It warms our little gamer hearts to see Deck of Stories cards all over social media and hear the stories you are crafting for your games.

Hey everyone,
We are so thankful for your support on the Deck of Stories, and our other projects. With this campaign coming to a close we’re proud to announce our newest Kickstarter, Dungeon Notes

Hello Everyone,
We've been hard at work these past few weeks and fulfillment is going great. We expect to have all AUS, CA, and US orders fulfilled by early next week! That means the majority of the backers should expect to see their packages soon. Of course, there will be shipping issues. There always are when it comes to Kickstarter, but we've got an amazing team and don't foresee many problems with the orders that have been shipped.
EU and UK

Hello Everyone!
Jason here, and I've been working with my friends @Cartographr_ar to bring you Cartographr: Augmented Reality Tabletop Terrain Builder, a brand new fast and easy, a digital version of tabletop terrain that’s affordable.

It's happening!
As of this week, we've officially started fulfillment on the Deck of Stories. We're so excited to get this product out to everyone and we can't wait to hear how you use the cards in your home games.
Over the course of the next few weeks, we'll be updating you with milestones in the fulfillment process. We have multiple partners working around the globe, and a lot of backers to get things sent to. Our expectation is the process will take around a month to complete. Please be patient if you end up being toward the back of the line, we are working to get things out as fast as possible.

Hey Everyone,
We wanted to keep you all up to speed on the saga of fulfillment. Some of the order has arrived at its destination, while some is still currently in transit on the water. The part that is still sailing is projected to arrive a week later than expected. That being said, even the parts of the shipments in port are in a very long queue to be offloaded, processed, customs, etc. We are being told this is due to the ongoing pandemic. The shipments could still experience other delays in port, and we will let you guys know if they do.

Hey Everyone,

We just wanted to make a quick update letting everyone know that our cards have been on the water for a little while now, and it looks like we'll still be able to start fulfillment towards the end of January as we had hoped. 
We'll make more updates as we get closer to starting fulfillment.

L.A. Jetpack Officers

  Many people think we shut our doors in 2007, but the truth — as you’d expect — is much stranger. We did have to become dormant for a wee bit of time; though not unlike so many other publications, ours simply ran out of money.
Malcontents say we closed, but you can’t stop passionate journalists from telling stories the world needs to know!
For more than 40 years the Weekly World News has covered stories the mainstream media has ignored, suppressed, or were afraid to take on. Stories that capture the imagination, that stir the soul, that allow people to wonder, to dream — and, at times, to scream!
With a record number of people feeling lost, confused, and yearning to know why Pluto has switched places with Venus - NOW IS THE TIME TO RESTORE THEIR COMPASS!!!

Weekly World News is a national treasure, a meaningful part of the American zeitgeist and culture for the past 40 years.
WE NEED YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT TO MAKE IT THRIVE ONCE AGAIN!
Weekly World News is for people and mutants of all kinds, especially those who know that “Seven United States Senators Are Aliens."
We are but a small band of intrepid, rabidly enthusiastic, highly over-caffeinated writers, editors, and artists; chasing down groundbreaking stories, like “A Florida Man Divorced His Washing Machine to Marry His Toaster.”
We go where the FACTS lead us! 
We’re on a bold journey through Hell’s Sinkhole, through Napoleon's Wormhole, time-traveling through challenges great, small, and microscopic as we climb to the top of Media Mountain!
Weekly World News is for those who understand there is more to this world, that there is a reality behind our reality…
Are we living in a simulation?
Is the world flat?
Does yam pudding cure baldness?
If all goes well, we can get Weekly World News back into print and back onto the supermarket magazine shelves. In 1574, Nostradamus predicted that we would be the dominant news publication from 2020 until 3030…
 Let’s prove him right — AGAIN! 
The world needs Weekly World News now, more than ever!
WWN was the pioneering “alternative” newspaper — without us, there would be no The Onion, Hard Times, Cracked, Reductress, Waterford Whisper News, The Babylon Bee, The Daily Show, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee and so many others.
David Byrne’s movie True Stories was based on Weekly World News tales.
We’ve been mentioned in countless films and TV shows, and our illustrious fans include Steven Spielberg, Howard Stern, Seth Rogen, Anderson Cooper, Stephen Colbert, Johnny Depp, and all the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
It’s time for the ORIGINAL, the FIRST, the BEST to regain its full voice and regain its hallowed place in society!

Ph.D. Ape has crunched the numbers and concluded that there are approximately 23.75 million people who know about (and love) Weekly World News. 
Weekly World News is also popular around the globe, with a rabid following in Great Britain, India, & Australia. We even have fans in Japan, where a version of WWN was translated & sold for years. We're in Brazil, where there seem to be a large number of alien headhunters who read Weekly World News while shrinking heads!
The mere mention of Weekly World News always brings a smile to someone’s face.
Weekly World News is YOUR publication, in which you can actively participate. 
This is a place for citizen journalists, for investigative reporters who share our vision, our values and our unique view of the world.
We WANT our readers to be actively involved in Weekly World News — sharing stories, videos, reports, and your tales of alien abductions and those horns on your head! 
We intend to keep our doors open to all readers and seekers of the truth, and we hope to continue to receive ground-breaking submissions everyday.
Not only will a successful project put Weekly World News BACK ON THE MAP, but it will help Lester Caine get out of his basement and back on the beat where he belongs!
EVERY SINGLE BACKER helps us send a clear message to the mainstream media - “We’ve got you scooped on ALL the WILDEST, WEIRDEST stories of the day!”
Thanks for reading.
We hope you'll join us in bringing back the WORLD’S ONLY RELIABLE NEWS!

Risks and challenges
1) The Gootans are trying to take over the earth, but luckily the Zeebans are working with us to defeat them, so we should be okay.

2) A gigantic asteroid might be headed for Timmy Johnson’s house in Butte, Montana, and it may wipe out the rest of the planet with it. But Ph.D. Ape is working on an “asteroid-killer,” so there’s hope.

3) A gigantic swimming dinosaur has been found in the South Pacific, and some baffled scientists believe that he has the ability to drink up ALL the ocean water on the planet. Earth without oceans — now that could be a real problem.

Other than those pesky little challenges, we've carefully priced out all of our expenses and printing costs. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. 

We know exactly how much work will be required to get Weekly World News relaunched. We can do this! All we need is the funding to finish the job.

campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message. 
Your shipping cost does not increase for add-ons regardless of your location or the amount of extra games you order. You will receive all add-on games at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery April 2021).  
The 18 original character paintings by Sarah Keele are available to purchase! The paintings are 8 x 10 inches and made with mixed media acrylic on masonite board. You can see some of the intricate details below. Email sarahmkeele@gmail.com for more details or to check availability of a specific character.    
Though this is not an add-on you can get through the campaign, the people at Next Level Board Gaming are selling 3D-printer files so that you can create an EPIC 3D version of the Bristol 1350 board that you can use with your copy of the game. You can see more details by clicking the picture below.
Regardless of order size or add-ons, shipping costs are $6 USA, $8 UK/EU, $10 Australia/Canada, $12 for the rest of the world. We work hard to find the best shipping rates out there, and we subsidize some of the shipping costs so that you don't have to pay as much. 
To avoid extra VAT or customs fees, games will ship to depots around the world (USA, UK, EU, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong) before being shipped to you. For non-depot countries, in most cases there will not be extra VAT costs because the price of our games is low enough to avoid the duties threshold.
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. Due to unreliable mail systems, we will not perform reshipments destined for Brazil, Ukraine, Russia, or South Africa. 
These days there are many projects that wait to charge shipping until AFTER the campaign ends in order to shift the risk from the creators to the backers. We have "done our homework" in regards to shipping costs and are prepared to take on unexpected risk. What you pay now for shipping is ALL that you will pay for this reward.
DISCOUNTED PRICE | Normal MSRP of the Standard Edition will be $25. If we release the Deluxe Edition to the public it will be at least $45. We also offer the best shipping prices we can during the Kickstarter campaign.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CARDS | The 9 Kickstarter Exclusive character cards (for a total of 18 characters in your game) will never be available again and will be unavailable to the public. Additionally, campaign stretch goals, as well as the Deluxe version, are only guaranteed through Kickstarter.
EARLY ACCESS | Receive and play the game before anyone else in the world. 
JOIN OUR TEAM | Get first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We will take your feedback into account before launching production.
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. (Per Kickstarter regulations, funds raised within Kickstarter will not be directly donated and have no effect on the donation amount).
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 4th project, and our first 3 have been delivered on time and as promised. Our factory is at full capacity and our shipping partners are optimistic that by next year when this is delivered there will be no insurmountable issues in regards to Covid-19. However, these are unique times and we will keep our backers updated on any unforeseen issues that may arise. As you can see from our photos, samples of the game have already been produced by our manufacturers and designs are complete. We just need to raise the funds and say go! 

Salem 1692: "I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier." -Snuffles00

Tortuga 1667: "I backed this and another project that ended a day prior. The way things have gone with the other project have given me an even greater appreciation for not only the great game you made, but the well executed Kickstarter. Thank you again!" -Bored Gamer

Deadwood 1876: "Thank you again for such a wonderful campaign and game! All your games are creative, refreshing, and each have unique mechanics that keep the fun going for hours. The historical component too makes for an added boon. Thank you also for a unique genuineness you bring to your customer experience. It is a prize how you answer each customer individually and how you care about the quality of your interactions as much as you care about the quality of your product and gameplay. I’m excited for the fourth city and experience!" -Steph Troyer

After the campaign we will use a pledge manager system called CrowdOx to send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account. You will be able to choose your add-on orders and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey up until a few weeks before we ship. Please never hesitate to message us directly with comments, concerns, or suggestions.

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We use high-quality components (wood pawns, neoprene playmat, magnetic book box) so that the game will last a long time.
Reusability and recyclability
Unlike most games, Bristol 1350 uses zero punchboards or plastic pop-outs. Nothing that you receive in the game needs to be thrown away.
Sustainable materials
Our factory uses recycled materials to produce the game box.

campaign.story:
Hello friends! As so many of us worry about the future and yearn to return to the glorious spring unfolding outside our quarantined windows, we're excited to bring you our newest, most enchanted project...

Created by illustrator Kevin Jay Stanton, this 78-card deck features traditional paintings rooted in classical tarot interpretations that delve into the lore and mythology of the plant kingdom.
For over five hundred years, humans have used Tarot cards as a tool for divination and meditation. Their archetypal symbols have mystical, philosophical and psychological implications that allow us to understand our past, our future, and ourselves. But even older than that is the symbolism we've always assigned to the plants that grow around us. Hermetic, alchemical and scientific traditions explore flowers as tools for making meaning, medicine and magic. 
BOTANICA marries the tradition of Tarot to a lexicon far more ancient: the natural vocabulary of life on Earth. 

BOTANICA takes all of the major and minor arcana of traditional Tarot and reinvents them in the language of flowers. The Queen of Swords is Red Oleander. The Hermit is a Chinese Lantern. The High Priestess is the Elderflower. The Devil is Nightshade.

The deck features  the complete set of 78 Tarot cards, illustrated with acrylic and ink paintings. The Major Arcana are defined by single plants and flowers, and the Minor Arcana are plants combined with the objects from their suit, with regalia on the court cards.
The cards are 3.25" x 4.15", printed on premium heavyweight card stock and emblazoned on the back with gold foil. Each deck will come with a booklet naming the plants and objects on each card, and explaining the symbolic meanings of each card. 
The set comes in three editions: THE HERBALIST, THE ALCHEMIST, and THE ENCHANTER. The details of each set are listed further down.
Divination is the process of finding meaning in symbols or patterns, and similarly the act of reading tarot is finding patterns, meaning and visions in the symbols. A larger picture is created when a story is formed from how one card interacts with the next, as a bouquet is created from the harmony between many flowers.
BOTANICA can be read in many ways, depending on what you’d like to get out of it. To start, you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the deck. Light a candle, play some evocative music, and think about how you respond to the cards you’ve drawn. Without looking at the meanings, what’s the first card that really resonates with you? What plant strikes a chord in you on first sight? 
 After you know the deck a bit better, it’s ready for use. Plants have always been a foundational part of how we treat our bodies, and Tarot can be a tool to help sort our thoughts. Consider drawing a card in the morning to guide you throughout the day. Ponder a question and draw three cards to meditate on the foundation of a problem, what it looks like currently, and how to handle it in the future. Or lay out a full ten-card spread and really get to the root of it all. 
Here is a small sampling of the cards included in the deck, with notes from their creator.


THE LOVERS represents emotional decisions and the union between independent and equal partners. I chose peonies because they have flamboyant blooms that are "perfect flowers" -- a botanical term for flowers with both reproductive parts --  and for the generosity they exhibit in their symbiotic relationship with ants. I think it’s important for modern decks to capture the essence of The Lovers, and for me it’s about people being their whole selves and sharing that with others, the way peonies share their dew with ants and are protected from predators in turn.
 Like the floating seeds of a dandelion, THE FOOL sets out on their journey full of hope and with the promise of new growth. It’s a common plant, almost ubiquitous, and carries with it a naive quality I find appealing - I love the idea of making a wish by blowing on its seeds.
Tarot is sometimes described as the journey of the Fool through the deck. That’s why I picked a weed that could weather all of that and still come out on the other side with a feeling of charm and whimsy to be the major symbol of Botanica.
THE SEVEN OF WANDS is represented by Datura, or Thorn Apple -- a highly poisonous species of flowering shrubs pollinated by bats. I picked it for this card because the Seven of Wands is about being ready for a battle and having the endurance to see it through, and the fruit of datura reputedly have the ability to heal wounds as much as they can cause harm.
I picked Japanese vajra (a Buddhist ritual object) for the wands because they’re a symbol of enlightenment that embodies the balance between the five poisons to one’s purity and the five wisdoms that help one attain it.

THE FOUR OF COINS is a card is about being trapped by comfort. Honeysuckle bears flowers with a sweet aroma that wafts through the summer air, attracting all manner of creatures. It can be an extremely invasive species, and in those cases its vines can take over native plants and literally choke them. The Four of Coins is a warning to avoid excess, to take time to smell the flowers.
The coin symbol I picked for this card is wampum, a beaded Native American currency, as the Common Honeysuckle is a species native to the eastern coast of North America. The shells of this protocurrency were harvested off the coast and prized as much for their value as decoration. Their beautiful swirls of purple and white were often woven into belts by tribes like the Iroquois.
 Here are the  three editions in which we're publishing BOTANICA.

The standard BOTANICA deck will include all 78 cards, and a booklet explaining the symbolic meaning of each card and each plant. Each deck comes in a sturdy tuckbox, blocked with gold foil.  Everything you need to read fortunes in the flowers.
 ***SOLD OUT***
THE ALCHEMIST is a collectible version of BOTANICA, limited to an edition of two hundred fifty. This edition is housed in an elaborately embossed tin with antique brass finishing, wrapped in the embroidered silk altar cloth. Each copy is signed and hand-numbered by the artist Kevin Jay Stanton. You will be thanked by name in the informational booklet that accompanies the deck.
THE ALTAR CLOTH
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions include a 24x24" silk altar cloth to be used for readings (or as a stylish neckerchief). In addition to being a beautiful way to encase your deck, each cloth is embroidered with symbols of the Arcana and imbued with the wishfulness and tenacity of dandelions.
THE COMPENDIUM
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST, ENCHANTER and HERBALIST AND COMPENDIUM tiers will come with a a compendium detailing the research, process art and theory that went into the creation of BOTANICA. THE COMPENDIUM is 96 pgs, roughly 4.5 x6.25", blocked with gold foil on the cover. If you wish to add the book (or an extra book) on to any existing order, just add $20 to any US order or $30 to any international order.  (NOTE: a digital PDF edition of the book will be included with all versions of the deck, as well as the A GLIMPSE and A READING tiers.)
THE DANDELION PIN
A 1" hard enamel dandelion pin, to be included with all ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions, as it's own rewards tier and add-on. If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.
THE EGLANTINE PIN
A 1" hard enamel eglantine pin, to be included with all ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions, as it's own rewards tier and add-on. If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.
THE DARK ALCHEMIST  is housed in an elaborately embossed tin with black finishing, wrapped in a silk altar cloth.  It comes with a booklet explaining the symbolic meaning of each card and each plant, as will as digital access to to a DRM-free PDF. Your name will be printed in the booklet in acknowledgement of your support of this project.

THE ENCHANTER, the rarest and most sorcerous edition of BOTANICA, is housed in a glass jewel box, which itself lives inside a 13" two-tier terrarium fashioned of glass and golden brass. The terrarium, designed in tribute to the Wardian Cases used to transport living plants to England from around the world, is filled with stone, bark and moss. The jewel box which houses the cards is surrounded by imitation cacti, succulent plants and silk flowers. KEVIN JAY STANTON is a freelance illustrator with a green thumb and penchant for creating more work than one person can handle. He spent his childhood playing a healthy dose of video games, as well as reading a ton of fairytales, mythology, and books on nature. Nowadays he does basically the same thing, but draws them too. With Annie Stoll, he co-created, curated, and art directed the 2nd Most Funded comic anthology project on Kickstarter: 1001 Knights.
BEEHIVE BOOKS is a Philadelphia-based boutique press founded by the artist and designer Maëlle Doliveux and author and editor Josh O’Neill. They create book art editions of great prose & pictorial works with a special emphasis on graphic art, design, and comics. Their line of books currently includes monographs on Harrison Cady and Herbert Crowley, illustrated novels with art by Yuko Shimizu, Bill Sienkiewicz, Dave McKean and Paul Pope, and the ongoing experimental periodical LAAB Magazine, curated and created by Ronald Wimberly.
In addition to being a three-time Eisner nominee, Beehive Books has won two Bronze Cubes from the Art Director’s Club and had two winners in the Communication Arts design competition. Their Illuminated Editions line has recently been exhibited at the Society of Illustrators in New York City.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the veterans of a dozen fully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns, Beehive Books founders Josh O’Neill and Maëlle Doliveux know well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Between our various ventures, we have raised nearly a million dollars on Kickstarter, and rewarded backers of every campaign with many beautiful books and other rewards.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money and how much work are required to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job. To be honest, our biggest risk is that in these turbulent times people won't have the funds to spend on art projects like these.

Still, there are more risks and challenges involved in making things with such high production values than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. Problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. (For instance, despite our considerable epidemiological expertise, we didn't see this global pandemic coming.) But our team has the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Click HERE to read our statement on our approach to the release of FOR SCIENCE!
Art not final
Cost:  While we would love to offer free shipping, there really is no such thing. Shipping is really expensive and we have tried to come up with pricing that accurately reflects our cost to get the game into your hands without creating a logistical nightmare on our side.  Your shipping will be added in the pledge manager.  We expect that we'll have to come out of pocket a bit based on what we are charging and we are ok with that.
Tracking: We will also be using non-trackable shipments in some cases in order to save on cost as tracking can add 30-50% or more in some cases. So please understand if we do not have tracking with your package we did so knowingly. Rest assured, that we will get you your game and any risk associated with a package not being trackable is on us.
Delivery time: While we would love to get everyone their games at the same time, it is just not possible. There is a high likelihood that some areas of the world will get their games before others. Our commitment is to get the games ready and printed as fast as possible (we've already done a ton of the prep work). At the factory we will break out the shipments to each fulfillment company with instructions to them that they should begin shipping as soon as possible upon receipt. In addition, because we have complete control over the U.S. shipments, you will not be able to order and receive the game on Amazon (or from any other US retailer) before our backers have it.   (Please note: Because of unexpected delays and other unforseen issues, we reserve the right to sell the game at major conventions, even if they have not been delivered yet).  The reason for this is that conventions are among the best form of marketing and therefore necessary to give the game the best chance for success.  One guarantee we will give is that if we do release the KS exclusive version anywhere before the backers receive theirs it will be at a price that is higher (usually significantly) than what was offered in the campaign.

Charity information:
* We will be donating up to $15,000 to Direct Relief.  
Per Kickstarter rules, no money collected for this campaign will go towards any donations.  All proceeds for charity will be donated from our own funds outside this campaign.  The charity we are donating to is Direct Relief.  Direct Relief works in the U.S. and internationally to equip doctors and nurses with life-saving medical resources to care for the world's most vulnerable people.  We chose them due to their stellar rating with Charity Navigator and for the specific work they do, especially in this current crisis affecting every corner of the world.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a publisher that has brought more than a dozen games to market thus far, we feel confident in our ability to get this done. The gameplay for this game is 95% complete. The art and graphics are well underway. We are confident that we will hit our release goals with no problems (shipping delays or Acts of God notwithstanding). In addition, our intention is to not release this game to standard retail until all U.S backers orders have been shipped. Our goal is to have it in our backers hands 1-3 weeks before someone can buy it on Amazon.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of our games are made with longevity in mind. We use high-quality components for all of our pieces. Short of losing pieces (which we typically replace for only shipping costs), our games should last you for decades to come.
Sustainable Distribution
All of our fulfillment and logistics are arranged to limit the number of miles/stops each game travels. It's not only better for the world, but it also makes business sense. Based on our previous campaigns, less than 5% of our games come all the way to our warehouse in the US before being shipped back out to other parts of the world.

Hello!

So this is frustrating. My belief was that a lot of you would have your games already and you would be enjoying the heck out of them. I recently asked for an update from our Fulfillment Partner, and they told me that they had made an error when they went to check in the inventory because they had used backer information for a completely different game and (rightfully so) couldn't figure out what was going on.

Hey everyone!

Thank you for your patience in getting this update out. I was hoping to have more information for you, regardless to where you are in the world, but things are in a bit of a stall here.

US/Canada/Rest of World - I have asked our Fulfillment warehouse for an update on when these will start being sent. The best response I have gotten from them is "soon". They have everything they need - the games, all of the pledge information, etc - they just need to get started putting things in boxes and putting them on trucks. As soon as I hear that that stuff is moving, I will let you know.

Lots of news today so I am going to break it down by location.

US/Canada/Rest of World - So, it appears that the games that are earmarked for our US/Canada/RoW backers have reached the west coast of the US and are in the hands of our fulfillment partner. They are getting these ready to be delivered to our warehouse and we will start the process of shipping these out. Games headed for the US will hopefully begin shipping next week. For Canada/Rest of World, you will need to add on a few weeks before they start getting sent.

Hello!

The vast majority of you have finalized your pledges but there are still a handful who have not completed your orders on Gamefound.

I will be closing the pledge manager to the completion of these orders at the end of the week, and if you do not complete your order, it is possible that there will be a delay in you getting your rewards.

Hey everyone!

Relatively quick update here today.

The manufacturing of For Science has been completed, and while I haven't got definitive word on whether or not it has been put on a boat, our freight company has asked us to pay for shipping, which is a good indicator that they have found a spot for our container.

Q: Is it balanced/fair to play TTRPGs with our Spinners?
A: Yes. We use centrifugal distribution on a flat surface with bearings that abstract the result at two levels (While the spinner spins at one speed, the bearings turn inside the channel at another, varying speed). It’s a similar mechanism as what Wheel of Fortune uses to more or less “guarantee” balance. But truthfully, there is no perfect system. We would certainly be confident in saying this is as balanced a result as rolling a high-end balanced die.
Q: What about the sequential numbers?
A: We've changed it! Given the ongoing and vehement response to this particular feature - we've been able to change and interleave the numbers so that they're non-sequential and always in opposing quadrants.  All backers will receive interleaved numbers.
It was a really strange month: October 2019. One of my friends had been laid off the week prior, and I was to take over his old office. Sitting there, eating a fibreOne bar he'd so graciously left behind in his desk, my friend David entered the room and together we assessed the rest of the valuables (beyond the box of fibreOnes, obviously) scattered about. 
That's when we saw it. A magic eight ball. It made us consider randomness. It made us wonder about probability. It made us ponder whether we needed to pursue other things before being fired ourselves. And when we asked if we should fully chase whatever dumb idea we had next, the eight-ball responded "It is decidedly so."
And so here we are on Kickstarter, with, you know, all the wisdom of a magic eight-ball, having fully convinced ourselves that this next dumb idea would be the dumb idea to help us break free. 
It is thus with a "spin of the dice" (to coin a new term)..., and after much planning, prototyping and months of play-testing, that we present our not-quite-as-dumb-as-we -might-once-have-thought idea:  
Because when you don't want to lose dice, it's best to not use them at all. 😜 The red indicator bearing points to the roll result.
Front view of the Mythroll 4:6/8:12 with the indicator pointing to the 6 on the upper row or 12 on the lower row.
On our 4:8/6:12 Model, half of the spinner shows a d4 and a d8, and the other half shows a d6 and a d12. The two red indicator bearings guarantees each half of the spinner always has an indicator when spun..
We have two objectives with this campaign.
1. To build a community of alternative rollers; or "Mythrollers" as we call them. Defined as "a group of people who share a boundless perspective on randomness and number rolling - and are unsatisfied with the polyhedral prisons they've been confined to." Dramatic? Yes. Exactly. 
2. To bring this unique idea to market with the help of said Mythrollers. 
 We've been designing, prototyping, game-testing and prepping for manufacture for approximately 6 months now - and the final build of the first two models are currently in production. 
Here's a bit of the process we've been through...
The original, October 3rd/2019 3D-rendered design of, what was at the time, called "The Scroller". 😂
November 2019: Let's call this time period "the exasperation".
During the month of November 2019 (or what we like to call "The Exasperation"), the debacle which was "electroplating" the numbers onto a conical steel item, caused our team in China to have to create over 25 unique iterations to get it right. This process... sucked. We had to design and implement a new technique to electroplate the numbers and lines in a multi-step process. But, we're now the proprietors of a new electroplating technique! Yay!
We were excited to put a video together to discuss our process a bit.
Each Mythroll Armory Spinner will be delivered in a delightfully logo-adorned, perfectly-shaped black box for safekeeping.
 We need the Kickstarter community for a few MAJOR reasons: 
1. Creating prototypes of this type costs approximately $250 per unit. We have a number of variations in the design phase. However, these variations cannot be created and brought to market without the funds provided by the Kickstarter community.  
2. Pre-orders will allow us to build a multitude of finishes and colours available for purchase DURING the kickstarter. We'll also be able to unlock a custom two-wide zip case (Pictured below).
3. To keep the costs of manufacturing low, we need to order several hundred spinners of each model at a time. That can't happen without the Kickstarter community supporting the project. 
4. We'd also love to push the manufacturing process along to build a d20 Spinner (rendering animation below). 
5. One of our goals is to become an Amazon FBA store so that, when someone wants a spinner, they can get it shipped to their home overnight. We cannot accomplish this without the support of the Kickstarter community. Once backers DO help us reach our goals - our new online Spinners Amazon FBA store will be available to all!

Keeping the Spinners in the original box or in a case to prevent dust getting in will allow the spinning action to last much longer.

Q: The bearings in the spinner fell out in transit! What do I do?
A: Take heart! Your spinner is not broken! We designed it so that if necessary, you can take it apart to clean the bearings and track. Properly taken care of, it will last a very long time. You’ll notice in the foam pad on the bottom there is a small hole. There may be a small piece of paper covering it. This is to indicate where the small screw is found for removal of the top ball and pin. It also sets the tension of the spinner. If repair or adjustments to tension are need, you can punch right through the paper to adjust the screw.

updates.update_userinfo: WGT? Update and some DIVINE NEWS!!
updates.update_content:
Afternoon all!!
WGT? 2nd edition is off the boat and heading to distribution houses across the globe and you should start seeing some tracking emails very soon! In the meantime Cory and Jesse are wanting to share some DIVINE NEWS with you!

Bidet Covians!
Everything is still on pace to begin distribution by end of this month or first of April! Now, enough of that good news nonsense, we need your help! Rick sent me a message this morning, which reads as follows:
"We need to do an update letting the backers know we are about to execute the final lockdown of addresses in the next couple of days so we can have our list finalized to the distributors at the end of the week. Once they get the final notice they will have 48 hours to make any address changes. If someone has to change their address between now and fulfillment, it will have to go through you."

Bidet Covians!
We've talked with our distributors and everything is going smoothly and we're still "on schedule" for a late March early April release! Don't believe me? Here's a picture of our lovely boxes on a pallet.

Bidet Covians!
Since you all love Sugar Ponies, and we love to give in to your masochistic tendencies, here's a quick update on the SP Collector Coin and cover art! Other than that nothing to report.

Dear Anthony,
I hope you're having a good time with family back in Texas. I hope you're eating lots of good food too! Things are okay here at the studio. Maimie is howling in every room non stop. I think she misses you. Jesse keeps going into your office to tell you something only he finds funny but then he realizes you're not here and gets really bummed out. Then he goes and tells Brent the same thing he was going to tell you. Which bums Brent out. It's getting colder here. What's the weather like in Texas? Oh!! Could you please stop by Buc-ee's and pick me up some Beaver Nuggets? Jesse says he wants Texas Whiskey. You don't have to bring him alcohol though, he's already mean enough without the help of the Devil's Water. Well, I better let you go. Rick has me cleaning up the back storage and the multiple brown recluse spider bites are making me feel light headed. Please come home soon.
